options.name: sensitivity
options.description: mouse sensitivity (legacy, may cause bugs if not 1, prefer input:sensitivity)

options.name: border_size
options.description: size of the border around windows

options.name: no_border_on_floating
options.description: disable borders for floating windows

options.name: gaps_in
options.description: gaps between windows, also supports css style gaps (top, right, bottom, left -> 5,10,15,20)

options.name: gaps_out
options.description: gaps between windows and monitor edges, also supports css style gaps (top, right, bottom, left -> 5,10,15,20)

options.name: gaps_workspaces
options.description: gaps between workspaces. Stacks with gaps_out.

options.name: col.inactive_border
options.description: border color for inactive windows

options.name: col.active_border
options.description: border color for the active window

options.name: col.nogroup_border
options.description: inactive border color for window that cannot be added to a group (see denywindowfromgroup dispatcher)

options.name: col.nogroup_border_active
options.description: active border color for window that cannot be added to a group

options.name: cursor_inactive_timeout
options.description: in seconds, after how many seconds of cursor’s inactivity to hide it. Set to 0 for never.

options.name: layout
options.description: which layout to use. [dwindle/master]

options.name: no_cursor_warps
options.description: if true, will not warp the cursor in many cases (focusing, keybinds, etc)

options.name: no_focus_fallback
options.description: if true, will not fall back to the next available window when moving focus in a direction where no window was found

options.name: apply_sens_to_raw
options.description: if on, will also apply the sensitivity to raw mouse output (e.g. sensitivity in games) NOTICE: really not recommended.

options.name: resize_on_border
options.description: enables resizing windows by clicking and dragging on borders and gaps

options.name: extend_border_grab_area
options.description: extends the area around the border where you can click and drag on, only used when general:resize_on_border is on.

options.name: hover_icon_on_border
options.description: show a cursor icon when hovering over borders, only used when general:resize_on_border is on.

options.name: allow_tearing
options.description: master switch for allowing tearing to occur. See the Tearing page.

options.name: resize_corner
options.description: force floating windows to use a specific corner when being resized (1-4 going clockwise from top left, 0 to disable)

blur.name: passes
blur.description: the amount of passes to perform

blur.name: ignore_opacity
blur.description: make the blur layer ignore the opacity of the window

blur.name: new_optimizations
blur.description: whether to enable further optimizations to the blur. Recommended to leave on, as it will massively improve performance.

blur.name: xray
blur.description: if enabled, floating windows will ignore tiled windows in their blur. Only available if blur_new_optimizations is true. Will reduce overhead on floating blur significantly.

blur.name: vibrancy_darkness
blur.description: How strong the effect of vibrancy is on dark areas . [0.0 - 1.0]

blur.name: special
blur.description: whether to blur behind the special workspace (note: expensive)

blur.name: popups
blur.description: whether to blur popups (e.g. right-click menus)

blur.name: popups_ignorealpha
blur.description: works like ignorealpha in layer rules. If pixel opacity is below set value, will not blur. [0.0 - 1.0]

options.name: rounding
options.description: rounded corners’ radius (in layout px)

options.name: active_opacity
options.description: opacity of active windows. [0.0 - 1.0]

options.name: inactive_opacity
options.description: opacity of inactive windows. [0.0 - 1.0]

options.name: fullscreen_opacity
options.description: opacity of fullscreen windows. [0.0 - 1.0]

options.name: drop_shadow
options.description: enable drop shadows on windows

options.name: shadow_range
options.description: Shadow range (“size”) in layout px

options.name: shadow_render_power
options.description: in what power to render the falloff (more power, the faster the falloff) [1 - 4]

options.name: shadow_ignore_window
options.description: if true, the shadow will not be rendered behind the window itself, only around it.

options.name: col.shadow
options.description: shadow’s color. Alpha dictates shadow’s opacity.

options.name: col.shadow_inactive
options.description: inactive shadow color. (if not set, will fall back to col.shadow)

options.name: shadow_offset
options.description: shadow’s rendering offset.

options.name: shadow_scale
options.description: shadow’s scale. [0.0 - 1.0]

options.name: dim_inactive
options.description: enables dimming of inactive windows

options.name: dim_strength
options.description: how much inactive windows should be dimmed [0.0 - 1.0]

options.name: dim_special
options.description: how much to dim the rest of the screen by when a special workspace is open. [0.0 - 1.0]

options.name: dim_around
options.description: how much the dimaround window rule should dim by. [0.0 - 1.0]

options.name: screen_shader
options.description: a path to a custom shader to be applied at the end of rendering. See examples/screenShader.frag for an example.

options.name: enabled
options.description: enable animations

options.name: first_launch_animation
options.description: enable first launch animation

touchpad.name: natural_scroll
touchpad.description: Inverts scrolling direction. When enabled, scrolling moves content directly instead of manipulating a scrollbar.

touchpad.name: scroll_factor
touchpad.description: Multiplier applied to the amount of scroll movement.

touchpad.name: middle_button_emulation
touchpad.description: Sending LMB and RMB simultaneously will be interpreted as a middle click. This disables any touchpad area that would normally send a middle click based on location. libinput#middle-button-emulation

touchpad.name: tap_button_map
touchpad.description: Sets the tap button mapping for touchpad button emulation. Can be one of lrm (default) or lmr (Left, Middle, Right Buttons). [lrm/lmr]

touchpad.name: clickfinger_behavior
touchpad.description: Button presses with 1, 2, or 3 fingers will be mapped to LMB, RMB, and MMB respectively. This disables interpretation of clicks based on location on the touchpad. libinput#clickfinger-behavior

touchpad.name: tap-to-click
touchpad.description: Tapping on the touchpad with 1, 2, or 3 fingers will send LMB, RMB, and MMB respectively.

touchpad.name: drag_lock
touchpad.description: When enabled, lifting the finger off for a short time while dragging will not drop the dragged item. libinput#tap-and-drag

touchpad.name: tap-and-drag
touchpad.description: Sets the tap and drag mode for the touchpad

touchdevice.name: transform
touchdevice.description: transform the input from touchdevices. The possible transformations are the same as those of the monitors

touchdevice.name: output
touchdevice.description: the monitor to bind touch devices. The default is autodetection. To stop autotection use an empty string or the “[[Empty]]” value.

touchdevice.name: enabled
touchdevice.description: Whether input is enabled for touch devices.

tablet.name: transform
tablet.description: transform the input from tablets. The possible transformations are the same as those of the monitors

tablet.name: output
tablet.description: the monitor to bind tablets. Empty means unbound.

tablet.name: region_position
tablet.description: position of the mapped region in monitor layout.

tablet.name: region_size
tablet.description: size of the mapped region. When this variable is set, tablet input will be mapped to the region. [0, 0] or invalid size means unset.

tablet.name: relative_input
tablet.description: whether the input should be relative

tablet.name: left_handed
tablet.description: if enabled, the tablet will be rotated 180 degrees

tablet.name: active_area_size
tablet.description: size of tablet’s active area in mm

tablet.name: active_area_position
tablet.description: position of the active area in mm

options.name: kb_model
options.description: Appropriate XKB keymap parameter. See the note below.

options.name: kb_layout
options.description: Appropriate XKB keymap parameter

options.name: kb_variant
options.description: Appropriate XKB keymap parameter

options.name: kb_options
options.description: Appropriate XKB keymap parameter

options.name: kb_rules
options.description: Appropriate XKB keymap parameter

options.name: kb_file
options.description: If you prefer, you can use a path to your custom .xkb file.

options.name: numlock_by_default
options.description: Engage numlock by default.

options.name: resolve_binds_by_sym
options.description: Determines how keybinds act when multiple layouts are used. If false, keybinds will always act as if the first specified layout were active. If true, keybinds specified by symbols activate if you type the respective symbol with the current layout.

options.name: repeat_rate
options.description: The repeat rate for held-down keys, in repeats per second.

options.name: repeat_delay
options.description: Delay before a held-down key is repeated, in milliseconds.

options.name: sensitivity
options.description: Sets the mouse input sensitivity. Value will be clamped to the range -1.0 to 1.0. libinput#pointer-acceleration

options.name: accel_profile
options.description: Sets the cursor acceleration profile. Can be one of adaptive, flat. Can also be custom, see below. Leave empty to use libinput’s default mode for your input device. libinput#pointer-acceleration [adaptive/flat/custom]

options.name: force_no_accel
options.description: Force no cursor acceleration. This bypasses most of your pointer settings to get as raw of a signal as possible. Enabling this is not recommended due to potential cursor desynchronization.

options.name: left_handed
options.description: Switches RMB and LMB

options.name: scroll_points
options.description: Sets the scroll acceleration profile, when accel_profile is set to custom. Has to be in the form <step> <points>. Leave empty to have a flat scroll curve.

options.name: scroll_method
options.description: Sets the scroll method. Can be one of 2fg (2 fingers), edge, on_button_down, no_scroll. libinput#scrolling [2fg/edge/on_button_down/no_scroll]

options.name: scroll_button
options.description: Sets the scroll button. Has to be an int, cannot be a string. Check wev if you have any doubts regarding the ID. 0 means default.

options.name: scroll_button_lock
options.description: If the scroll button lock is enabled, the button does not need to be held down. Pressing and releasing the button once enables the button lock, the button is now considered logically held down. Pressing and releasing the button a second time logically releases the button. While the button is logically held down, motion events are converted to scroll events.

options.name: scroll_factor
options.description: Multiplier added to scroll movement for external mice. Note that there is a separate setting for touchpad scroll_factor.

options.name: natural_scroll
options.description: Inverts scrolling direction. When enabled, scrolling moves content directly instead of manipulating a scrollbar.

options.name: follow_mouse
options.description: Specify if and how cursor movement should affect window focus. See the note below. [0/1/2/3]

options.name: mouse_refocus
options.description: If disabled and follow_mouse=1 then mouse focus will not switch to the hovered window unless the mouse crosses a window boundary.

options.name: float_switch_override_focus
options.description: If enabled (1 or 2), focus will change to the window under the cursor when changing from tiled-to-floating and vice versa. If 2, focus will also follow mouse on float-to-float switches.

options.name: special_fallthrough
options.description: if enabled, having only floating windows in the special workspace will not block focusing windows in the regular workspace.

options.name: workspace_swipe
options.description: enable workspace swipe gesture on touchpad

options.name: workspace_swipe_fingers
options.description: how many fingers for the touchpad gesture

options.name: workspace_swipe_distance
options.description: in px, the distance of the touchpad gesture

options.name: workspace_swipe_touch
options.description: enable workspace swiping from the edge of a touchscreen

options.name: workspace_swipe_invert
options.description: invert the direction

options.name: workspace_swipe_min_speed_to_force
options.description: minimum speed in px per timepoint to force the change ignoring cancel_ratio. Setting to 0 will disable this mechanic.

options.name: workspace_swipe_cancel_ratio
options.description: how much the swipe has to proceed in order to commence it. (0.7 -> if > 0.7 * distance, switch, if less, revert) [0.0 - 1.0]

options.name: workspace_swipe_create_new
options.description: whether a swipe right on the last workspace should create a new one.

options.name: workspace_swipe_direction_lock
options.description: if enabled, switching direction will be locked when you swipe past the direction_lock_threshold (touchpad only).

options.name: workspace_swipe_direction_lock_threshold
options.description: in px, the distance to swipe before direction lock activates (touchpad only).

options.name: workspace_swipe_forever
options.description: if enabled, swiping will not clamp at the neighboring workspaces but continue to the further ones.

options.name: workspace_swipe_numbered
options.description: if enabled, swiping will swipe on consecutive numbered workspaces.

options.name: workspace_swipe_use_r
options.description: if enabled, swiping will use the r prefix instead of the m prefix for finding workspaces. (requires disabled workspace_swipe_numbered)

groupbar.name: font_family
groupbar.description: font used to display groupbar titles

groupbar.name: priority
groupbar.description: sets the decoration priority for groupbars

groupbar.name: render_titles
groupbar.description: whether to render titles in the group bar decoration

groupbar.name: scrolling
groupbar.description: whether scrolling in the groupbar changes group active window

groupbar.name: text_color
groupbar.description: controls the group bar text color

groupbar.name: col.inactive
groupbar.description: inactive (out of focus) group border color

options.name: insert_after_current
options.description: whether new windows in a group spawn after current or at group tail

options.name: focus_removed_window
options.description: whether Hyprland should focus on the window that has just been moved out of the group

options.name: col.border_active
options.description: active group border color

options.name: col.border_inactive
options.description: inactive (out of focus) group border color

options.name: col.border_locked_active
options.description: active locked group border color

options.name: col.border_locked_inactive
options.description: inactive locked group border color

options.name: disable_hyprland_logo
options.description: disables the random hyprland logo / anime girl background. :(

options.name: disable_splash_rendering
options.description: disables the hyprland splash rendering. (requires a monitor reload to take effect)

options.name: col.splash
options.description: Changes the color of the splash text (requires a monitor reload to take effect).

options.name: splash_font_family
options.description: Changes the font used to render the splash text, selected from system fonts (requires a monitor reload to take effect).

options.name: force_default_wallpaper
options.description: Enforce any of the 3 default wallpapers. Setting this to 0 disables the anime background. -1 means “random” [-1 - 3]

options.name: vfr
options.description: controls the VFR status of hyprland. Heavily recommended to leave on true to conserve resources.

options.name: vrr
options.description: controls the VRR (Adaptive Sync) of your monitors. 0 - off, 1 - on, 2 - fullscreen only [0/1/2]

options.name: mouse_move_enables_dpms
options.description: If DPMS is set to off, wake up the monitors if the mouse moves.

options.name: key_press_enables_dpms
options.description: If DPMS is set to off, wake up the monitors if a key is pressed.

options.name: always_follow_on_dnd
options.description: Will make mouse focus follow the mouse when drag and dropping. Recommended to leave it enabled, especially for people using focus follows mouse at 0.

options.name: layers_hog_keyboard_focus
options.description: If true, will make keyboard-interactive layers keep their focus on mouse move (e.g. wofi, bemenu)

options.name: animate_manual_resizes
options.description: If true, will animate manual window resizes/moves

options.name: animate_mouse_windowdragging
options.description: If true, will animate windows being dragged by mouse, note that this can cause weird behavior on some curves

options.name: disable_autoreload
options.description: If true, the config will not reload automatically on save, and instead needs to be reloaded with hyprctl reload. Might save on battery.

options.name: enable_swallow
options.description: Enable window swallowing

options.name: swallow_regex
options.description: The class regex to be used for windows that should be swallowed (usually, a terminal). To know more about the list of regex which can be used use this cheatsheet.

options.name: swallow_exception_regex
options.description: The title regex to be used for windows that should not be swallowed by the windows specified in swallow_regex (e.g. wev). The regex is matched against the parent (e.g. Kitty) window’s title on the assumption that it changes to whatever process it’s running.

options.name: focus_on_activate
options.description: Whether Hyprland should focus an app that requests to be focused (an activate request)

options.name: no_direct_scanout
options.description: Disables direct scanout. Direct scanout attempts to reduce lag when there is only one fullscreen application on a screen (e.g. game). It is also recommended to set this to true if the fullscreen application shows graphical glitches.

options.name: hide_cursor_on_touch
options.description: Hides the cursor when the last input was a touch input until a mouse input is done.

options.name: mouse_move_focuses_monitor
options.description: Whether mouse moving into a different monitor should focus it

options.name: suppress_portal_warnings
options.description: disables warnings about incompatible portal implementations.

options.name: render_ahead_of_time
options.description: [Warning: buggy] starts rendering before your monitor displays a frame in order to lower latency

options.name: render_ahead_safezone
options.description: how many ms of safezone to add to rendering ahead of time. Recommended 1-2.

options.name: cursor_zoom_factor
options.description: the factor to zoom by around the cursor. AKA. Magnifying glass. Minimum 1.0 (meaning no zoom)

options.name: cursor_zoom_rigid
options.description: whether the zoom should follow the cursor rigidly (cursor is always centered if it can be) or loosely

options.name: allow_session_lock_restore
options.description: if true, will allow you to restart a lockscreen app in case it crashes (red screen of death)

options.name: background_color
options.description: change the background color. (requires enabled disable_hyprland_logo)

options.name: close_special_on_empty
options.description: close the special workspace if the last window is removed

options.name: new_window_takes_over_fullscreen
options.description: if there is a fullscreen window, whether a new tiled window opened should replace the fullscreen one or stay behind. 0 - behind, 1 - takes over, 2 - unfullscreen the current fullscreen window [0/1/2]

options.name: enable_hyprcursor
options.description: whether to enable hyprcursor support

options.name: pass_mouse_when_bound
options.description: if disabled, will not pass the mouse events to apps / dragging windows around if a keybind has been triggered.

options.name: scroll_event_delay
options.description: in ms, how many ms to wait after a scroll event to allow to pass another one for the binds.

options.name: workspace_back_and_forth
options.description: If enabled, an attempt to switch to the currently focused workspace will instead switch to the previous workspace. Akin to i3’s auto_back_and_forth.

options.name: allow_workspace_cycles
options.description: If enabled, workspaces don’t forget their previous workspace, so cycles can be created by switching to the first workspace in a sequence, then endlessly going to the previous workspace.

options.name: workspace_center_on
options.description: Whether switching workspaces should center the cursor on the workspace (0) or on the last active window for that workspace (1)

options.name: focus_preferred_method
options.description: sets the preferred focus finding method when using focuswindow/movewindow/etc with a direction. 0 - history (recent have priority), 1 - length (longer shared edges have priority)

options.name: ignore_group_lock
options.description: If enabled, dispatchers like moveintogroup, moveoutofgroup and movewindoworgroup will ignore lock per group.

options.name: movefocus_cycles_fullscreen
options.description: If enabled, when on a fullscreen window, movefocus will cycle fullscreen, if not, it will move the focus in a direction.

options.name: overlay
options.description: print the debug performance overlay. Disable VFR for accurate results.

options.name: damage_blink
options.description: (epilepsy warning!) flash areas updated with damage tracking

options.name: disable_logs
options.description: disable logging to a file

options.name: disable_time
options.description: disables time logging

options.name: damage_tracking
options.description: redraw only the needed bits of the display. Do not change. (default: full - 2) monitor - 1, none - 0

options.name: enable_stdout_logs
options.description: enables logging to stdout

options.name: manual_crash
options.description: set to 1 and then back to 0 to crash Hyprland.

options.name: suppress_errors
options.description: if true, do not display config file parsing errors.

options.name: watchdog_timeout
options.description: sets the timeout in seconds for watchdog to abort processing of a signal of the main thread. Set to 0 to disable.

options.name: disable_scale_checks
options.description: disables verifying of the scale factors. Will result in pixel alignment and rounding errors.

options.name: error_limit
options.description: limits the number of displayed config file parsing errors.
